alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 3:42PM MST until December 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY... ...TRAVEL IMPACTS DUE TO BLOWING SNOW THROUGH FRIDAY... .Snowfall today with a quick moving system will exit the area by early this evening. However, gusty winds will persist across much of the area through early Friday, with the strongest winds developing late tonight through Thursday evening. The combination of wind and freshly fallen snowfall will result in blowing snow and blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times across the northwest into west central South Dakota plains. Areas of blowing snow can be expected elsewhere on the plains, with reduced visibilities at times, especially on Thursday. Dangerously cold wind chills will continue over western South Dakota and northeastern Wyoming through the week. The coldest wind chills are expected tonight through Friday morning, with values of 30 below to near 60 below zero in most areas through Friday morning. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected at times. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County, Western Crook County and the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
